title: New class wizard doesn't set default context for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard in the IDE, the context is not set correctly when creating nested classes.
OB: When using the new class wizard in the IDE and selecting the 'Enclosing Type' checkbox, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank even with a .java file open in the editor.
EB: When using the new class wizard in the IDE and selecting the 'Enclosing Type' checkbox, the 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click the new class button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' checkbox.
4. Verify that the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
